# requiresSecureCoding

**Instance Property**

Indicates whether the archiver requires all archived classes to resist object substitution attacks.

## Declaration

```swift
var requiresSecureCoding: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

[doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if this coder requires secure coding; [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] otherwise.

Secure coders check a set of allowed classes before decoding objects, and all objects must implement the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSSecureCoding] protocol.

## Related Documentation

- **allowsKeyedCoding**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the receiver supports keyed coding of objects.

## Secure Coding

- **allowedClasses**: The set of coded classes allowed for secure coding.
